message.entry: Transport layer object is corrupted. Clear and recreate the hardware object.
Invalid transport layer object. Supported transport layer are {0}.

Unable to receive data from the target hardware. \n For MATLAB, reconnect the target hardware, clear the hardware objects and try again. \n For Simulink, reconnect the target hardware and start simulation again.
Packet size is changing at runtime.

On demand storage buffer for received data is full. The buffer size will increase dynamically which might affect performance. To avoid performance issues, increase the on demand storage using Name-Value pair 'DataStorageOnDemandLength' during IOProtocol object creation.
Response size for request ID 0x{0} is expected as {1} but received as {2}.
Not enough memory on the target to buffer the data. Data dropped may be seen in the logged data.
No debug object is present on host to decode the trace messages from hardware. Either disable traceOn or create a new hardware object.
Error occurred while decoding the trace message corresponding to message Id {0}.
No debug message is defined for message id {0}.

Unable to read the data from the I2C device. Check the connections between the hardware and device, For MATLAB clear the device object and try again. For Simulink, stop the simulation and start again.

Reading data from I2C device timed out. This issue occurs when the connection between the hardware and I2C device is not intact. Check the connections between the hardware and device, For MATLAB clear the device object and try again. For Simulink, stop the simulation and start again.
Time required to fetch one frame is too high. Consider reducing the SamplesPerRead or increasing the SampleRate.
The internal buffers to store data is full. Read data to clear the buffers so that you can continue reading data from the hardware.
The target hardware cannot read data as the Sample time/Sample rate is not a positive number.
No C function found on server for request ID "0x{0}".
Current Data size is {0} bytes. Data size must be less than or equal to {1} bytes.
Current response Data size is {0} bytes. Response Data size must be less than or equal to {1} bytes.
Not enough memory to create buffers on target. Increase the heap size or Sample time (decrease Sample rate) of the Source/Sensor.
The target hardware is in an overrun condition. Increase the Sample time (decrease Sample rate) of the Source/Sensor.
Utilization should be greater than zero and less than or equal to 1.
Invalid Stop bit type value, expected value to be one of these values: 0.5, 1, 1.5 or 2
Streaming configuration is not done. Configure streaming before starting to stream.
Sample rates not set for all sources. Set sample rate for all streaming sources.
Invalid debug object provided.
'external' serial object creation is not supported. Instead, use 'internal' while creating the serial object.
'external' tcpclient object creation is not supported. Instead, use 'internal' while creating the tcpclient object.
Command queue is full.
No command available in command queue.
Memory address length and addressbuswidth are not equal.
Expecting an array in the range 0-255 for memoryAddress.
Expecting a value in the range 0-65535 for responseSize or Data.
Expecting an array in the range 0-65535 for data.
The value is not of numeric type.
The value is not of logical type.
The passed parameter is not a cell array.
Length of responseSize or Data is not a multiple of charsize.
Mismatch between dataType, bitPosition and bitValue
Specified Serial port is in use.
Specified Serial port is not available in the serial list.
Connected I/O: Unsupported Communication Interface.
IO Server will be regenerated due to Configuration Parameter changes.
IO Server will be regenerated due to USART Configuration Parameter changes.
IO Server will be regenerated due to ADC Parameter changes.
IO Server will be regenerated due to STM32CubeMX project file updates.
Simulink Connected IO: Error: IO server is not flashed properly. Reconnect the board and try again.
Simulink Connected IO: Unable to get the latest server version number.
Wrong data type specified
Size of input does not match the size of output.
Number of inputs does not match the number of datatypes.
The number of elements in Size must be the same as Datatype.
Input {0} has incorrect datatype. Expected: {1}, Actual: {2}
Unsupported datatype: {0}
Pack input data into a single output vector of required type.
Unpack input data packet into its constituent data vectors of required type.
Output datatypes.
Output size.
Datatype must be a cell array.
Size must be a cell array.
Size must contain positive numeric vectors.
